thread.title: Bentley completes Husky sweep
thread.title_full: Bentley completes Husky sweep | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Bentley completes Husky sweep
text:
Matt Blomquist and Tanner Jago set up a pair of goals, as Bentley scored four unanswered to beat Northeastern, 4-1, last night in Watertown and complete a weekend sweep of the Huskies.
The Falcons (2-2-0) got another strong effort from goaltender Jayson Argue, who followed up his 49-save performance in Friday’s 3-2 victory by making 40 stops last night against the first Hockey East foe to play at Ryan Arena.
Mike Berry gave the hosts the lead just 1:13 into play, and Will Suter doubled the lead at 6:56 of the first period. Top scorer Andrew Gladiuk, who had the hat trick on Friday, scored his fourth of the season on the power play at 10:37 of the second.
Kyle Schmidt’s unassisted tally at 3:28 of the third pushed the lead to four goals. The Huskies (1-2-0) spoiled Argue’s shutout bid when Nolan Stevens scored at 7:05 of the third.
Boston University 4, Wisconsin 1 — Brandon Fortunato’s power-play goal at 9:04 of the second period stood up as the game-winner, and he added an assist in the third period to lead the No. 6 ranked Terriers (1-1-0) over the Badgers (0-2-2) in the home opener at Agganis Arena.
BU dominated, posting a 44-18 shot advantage. After the Badgers took the lead just 82 seconds into play, it took until the second period for the hosts to tie it on Matt Lane’s goal at 1:36. The Terriers put it away with goals by Chase Phelps and Bobo Carpenter in the third. Connor LaCouvee made 17 saves to earn the win in net.
Merrimack 3, St. Lawrence 1 — Second-period goals by Brian Christie and Brett Seney were enough for the Warriors (2-0-0) to dispatch the Saints (3-1-0) in a nonleague game at Lawlor Arena.
Chris LeBlanc scored with 2:15 to play to complete Merrimack’s scoring, and Collin Delia made 21 saves.
UMass-Lowell 2, Colorado College 1 — Ryan McGrath’s goal at 4:17 of the second period stood up as the winner, as the No. 9 River Hawks (3-0-0) held off the Tigers (0-4-0) in a nonleague game at the Tsongas Center.
Adam Chapie got the hosts off on the right foot at 15:05 of the first, while Kevin Boyle made 23 stops.
Union 2, Maine 0 — Sebastien Gringas broke a scoreless deadlock 5:36 into the final period, and Jake Kupsky stopped all 26 shots he faced as the host Dutchmen (2-0-2) blanked the Black Bears (0-1-3) in Schenectady, N.Y. Matt Morris made 31 saves for the visitors.
Clarkson 4, New Hamps hire 3 — Matt Dawson scored at 10:03 of the third to tie the game for the Wildcats (1-2-0), but Jeff DiNallo scored with just 42 second left to lift the Golden Knights (3-1-0) to victory in Durham, N.H.
Women
Boston College 4, Maine 0 — Katie Burt made 17 stops to post the shutout, while Alex Carpenter’s ninth tally of the season capped the attack as the No. 2 Eagles (5-0-0, 1-0-0) opened their Hockey East schedule by silencing the Black Bears (1-4-0, 1-2-0) at Kelley Rink.
Kristyn Capizzano added two assists for BC.
Clarkson 4, Boston University 1 — Erin O’Neil made 37 saves, but she had no answer for Olivia Howe (two goals) as the No. 4 Golden Knights (7-0-0) took out the No. 9 Terriers (3-3-0) at Walter Brown Arena.
Northeastern 7, Mercyhurst 3 — Denisa Krizova notched the hat trick and Kendall Coyne added her second of the game in a five-goal third period, as the Huskies (4-1-1) rallied from a 3-2 deficit after two periods to sink the Lakers (0-3-1) at Matthews Arena.
